edu.washington.apl.aganse.dataTools
Class DataSeries

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      java.util.AbstractList<E>
          java.util.Vector
              edu.washington.apl.aganse.dataTools.DataSeries
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable, java.util.Collection, java.util.List, java.util.RandomAccess
public class DataSeries
extends java.util.Vector

DataSeries - a Vector class to hold 2D dataseries points and provide statistical information about them like mean, stdev, regression lines, etc. Dataseries are easily displayed in interactive plot via DataPlotWindow class.
Note the Point subclass which holds the x,y values; the DataSeries is made up of these Points, and the Point class may also be used publically to cast a separate single-point variable, such a temp-var used in comparisions.
Per convention, x is the independent variable, and is the variable used for sorting.

Version:
18 Sep 2015 (initial version 24 Jan 2000)
Author:
Andy Ganse,
Applied Physics Laboratory,
University of Washington.
See Also:
DataPlotWindow, DepthDataPlotWindow, SingleRegressionLine, DoubleRegressionLine, TripleRegressionLine, Serialized Form

subSeries

public DataSeries subSeries(int minInd,
                            int maxInd)
Returns a DataSeries object with the subset of the data specified by minInd and maxInd, both inclusive. Note maxInd must be < numPts.

bestRegressionLine

public double[] bestRegressionLine()
Returns an array of varying size which specifies the stdDev of the residuals and some other parameters of the best linear regression line (single, dual, or triple) fitted to the data, based on a default tolerance value for the standard deviation of the residuals (current default stdDevTol=10.0). See bestRegressionLine(double stdDevTol) for details.

bestRegressionLine

public double[] bestRegressionLine(double stdDevTol1,
                                   double stdDevTol2,
                                   double stdDevTol3)
Returns an array of varying size which specifies the stdDev of the residuals and some other parameters of the best linear regression line (single, dual, or triple) fitted to the data, based on the specified tolerance value (stdDevTol) for the standard deviation of the residuals. Returned array contains:
a[0] = stdDev of the residuals of the fitted line (always in array)
a[1] = x1 of 1st fitted line (if any line fitted at all)
a[2] = y1 of 1st fitted line (if any line fitted at all)
a[3] = x2 of 1st fitted line (if any line fitted at all)
a[4] = y2 of 1st fitted line (if any line fitted at all)
a[5] = x3 of second fitted line (if at least two lines fitted)
a[6] = y3 of second fitted line (if at least two lines fitted)
a[7] = x4 of third fitted line (if three lines fitted)
a[8] = y4 of third fitted line (if three lines fitted)

Recommended usage:
for double[] foo = data.bestRegressionLine(10.0), check foo.length() to know which array elements to use.

sort

public void sort()
Rearranges the datapoints into sorted order based on x value

negateX

public DataSeries negateX()
Multiplies -1 by each X value in the dataseries. Useful when dealing with depths on that axis

resample

public DataSeries resample(double incr)
Interpolates the current dataseries into a new dataseries spaced at the given increment - note the data has to get sorted in the process. Based on getSoundSpeed(z) from P. Brodsky's SoundSpeedProfile class.

computeLinearGradients

public void computeLinearGradients()
Compute linear gradients. There are (numpts-1) gradients. This MUST be run before interpolateY(x) can be called (they're separated so interpolateY(x) can be called multiple times efficiently). The ith gradient is valid from x[i] to x[i+1].

interpolateY

public double interpolateY(double x)
Interpolates a y-value from the dataseries given x-value. WARNING: Requires computeLinearGradient() to be called first! (This is so that interpolateY(x) can be called multiple times efficiently.) Based on getSoundSpeed(z) from P. Brodsky's SoundSpeedProfile class.

clear

public void clear()
Clears the DataSeries object of all Points and resets all statistical calculation parameters

Specified by:
clear in interface java.util.Collection
Specified by:
clear in interface java.util.List
Overrides:
clear in class java.util.Vector

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a String representation of dataseries, as a column of its x,y values. Beware, this could be a long column.

Overrides:
toString in class java.util.Vector

addExampleData

public void addExampleData()
Adds a predefined set of datapoints to the dataseries. The current example data is a somewhat textbook-like soundspeed profile of 26 points, in meters (depth) on the x axis, and meters per second (soundspeed) on the y axis.
